content.description: Start in a deep corner and climb a steep blocky roof with a crack.  Continue direct on easier ground with bolts and gear mixed.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 1 piton, gear to 0.25", 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Just left of large gully near center of the crag.

content.description: This climbs a line that is mainly contrived. Climb a slab through corners and roofs. Finishes left.
content.location: This is the furthest right of the climbs at independence.

content.description: Currently unfinished.  Located on steep ground between the two sections that have routes.  Hard crux.  Nearly complete.

begin on big ledge,    Climb overhanging layback,    Rest on good foot ledge.  

  Climb fun finger crack,    Shake out, enter pumpy crux,   Place many small cams. 

  Now you are so pumped,   Climb long section of 5.10,    Clip chains, you finished.
content.protection: 4 bolts, small and medium gear, two bolt anchor.
content.location: Climbs the layback crack from the large ledge in the center of the wall.

content.description: This route is to the right of 999. the first bolt is 20 or 25ft up which is the PG13 section, it might be possible to put a larger cam in a crack about 15ft up.
content.protection: 8 bolts and small medium gear. Shared anchor with 999.

content.description:
This route climbs up between two corner systems past a drill hole and then past an iron rod (don't impale yourself) it continues up passing many bolts and gear placements.  

  It's best to extend the bolt that is further left than all the rest.  

  There are many bolts in the last 20ft of climbing, and fewer at the bottom.
content.protection: 9 bolts, gear to 3 inches, two bolt rap anchor.

content.description:
This route, like most of the routes at Independence, seems haphazardly bolted. Either you're climbing through run out terrain with poor gear or clipping a bolt every three feet.  

  Fun techy climbing on pinches and side pulls.  

  There is a runout to the chains which can be protected by a weird cam or a brown tricam.
content.protection: 7 bolts, small gear 00 to .5 and one larger piece, maybe .75 or a 1.
content.location: This route is just right of the dirty choss gully.

content.description: Same start as 24 Karat, moves left after the first bolt and follows the very clean arete through super thin moves.  After the 7th bolt you can move right to meet with 24 Karat, or continue the route direct through several more bolts and gear.
content.location: Furthest route on the left side.

content.description: Start high on the cliff left of the main climbing area.  Move immediately right over a roof and into a corner.  Follow the bolt line with a crux near the top.
content.protection: 15 bolts and small cam placements (optional) in a couple of spots.
content.location: Crag is located near large tailings pile, easily visible from the visitors center.  This route and 23 Karat start at furthest left part of this cliff.

content.description: This crag is located above Independence Mine. I has several lines from 5.9 to 5.11. Most of these require some gear. There are plenty of scenic qualities in this area, including the original 1908 mine shaft. Keep in mind that these shafts are very, very unstable and shouldn't be entered.
